item.title: 巴菲特的伯克希尔公司因盈利和继任风险罕见遭到抛售
item.description: 伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司（Berkshire Hathaway Inc. 获得罕见的卖出评级，分析师对其盈利前景持谨慎态度，并持续担忧沃伦-巴菲特即将离职和宏观风险。【原文：Berkshire Hathaway Inc. got a rare sell rating, with analysts cautious on its earnings outlook and ongoing concerns over Warren Buffett’s upcoming departure and macro risks.】

item.title: 国际清算银行称私人信贷风险 "夸大 "了小公司的评级
item.description: 国际清算银行表示，保险公司使用的私人信用等级往往集中在较小的评级公司中，这增加了 "信用度评估被夸大 "的风险。【原文：Private credit grades used by insurance companies tend to be concentrated among smaller ratings firms, raising the risk of “inflated assessments of creditworthiness,” the Bank for International Settlements said.】

item.title: 波兰与帕兰提尔和 Anduril 签订协议，军队开支创历史新高
item.description: 波兰周一分别与帕兰提尔科技公司（Palantir Technologies Inc.【原文：Poland signed two separate deals with Palantir Technologies Inc. and Anduril Industries Inc. on Monday as the country steps up to upgrade its army amid record military spending.】

item.title: Blackstone 利用私人信贷发放 Signant 贷款
item.description: 据熟悉该交易的人士透露，Blackstone Inc. 正牵头为生命科学公司 Signant Health 进行私人信贷融资，以取代超过 10 亿美元的银行牵头的杠杆贷款。【原文：Blackstone Inc. is leading a private credit financing for life-sciences company Signant Health to replace more than $1 billion in bank-led leveraged loans, according to people familiar with the transaction.】

item.title: 米莱赢得重塑阿根廷的新机会和严峻挑战
item.description: 哈维尔-米莱伊（Javier Milei）的政党在周日晚些时候举行的中期选举中大获全胜，并得到了美国的支持，这为这位自由主义总统提供了新的动力，促使他寻求彻底改革阿根廷，打破该国债务、违约和危机的恶性循环。【原文：A resounding win for Javier Milei’s party in midterm elections late Sunday — with a lifeline from the US — gave the libertarian president new momentum for his quest to overhaul Argentina and break the country’s cycle of debt, default and crisis.】

item.title: 卡尔希起诉纽约赌博监管机构，指控州政府越权
item.description: 预测市场 Kalshi 公司起诉纽约博彩委员会，称该州政府机构越权试图监管完全属于联邦管辖范围的体育博彩业务。【原文：Predictions marketplace Kalshi Inc. sued New York’s gaming commission, saying the state agency is overstepping its authority by attempting to regulate sports-betting operations that fall exclusively under federal jurisdiction.】

item.title: 加拿大着手禁止银行和其他联邦监管工作场所实行非竞争协议
item.description: 加拿大政府将提议修改法律，禁止在联邦监管的工作场所（包括银行）的雇佣合同中加入非竞争协议。【原文：The Canadian government will propose legal changes to ban non-compete agreements in employment contracts at federally regulated workplaces, including banks.】

item.title: 家族经营的英国工程师公司业绩飙升，投资者竞相追捧国防企业
item.description: 周一，一家由其创始家族第六代经营的、拥有 142 年历史的英国工程公司进一步成为股市的焦点，投资者纷纷关注该公司与军费开支增长的关系。【原文：A 142-year-old UK engineering firm run by the sixth generation of its founding family was thrust further into the stock market spotlight Monday, as investors pounce on its ties to rising military spending.】

item.title: 达美航空进军中东，首开沙特直飞航班
item.description: 达美航空公司（Delta Air Lines Inc. ）计划开通亚特兰大至利雅得的直飞航班，该航空公司希望在中东地区站稳脚跟，并充分利用美国总统唐纳德-特朗普今年早些时候访问沙特阿拉伯后美国与沙特阿拉伯之间不断深化的关系。【原文：Delta Air Lines Inc. plans to start direct flights from Atlanta to Riyadh as the carrier looks to secure a foothold in the Middle East and capitalize on deepening ties between the US and Saudi Arabia following President Donald Trump’s visit earlier this year.】

item.title: 高通公司利用新的人工智能芯片瞄准英伟达后一路飙升
item.description: 高通公司发布了面向利润丰厚的人工智能数据中心市场的芯片和计算机，掀起了自2019年以来最大的股价涨势，其目标是在该行业增长最快的领域挑战英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp.【原文：Qualcomm Inc. kicked off its biggest stock rally since 2019 after unveiling chips and computers for the lucrative AI data center market, aiming to challenge Nvidia Corp. in the fastest-growing part of the industry.】

item.title: 美联储和财报周拉开帷幕，股市因贸易进展跳涨
item.description: 周一早盘，美国股市上涨，原因是在华尔街关键的一周里，美国和中国在大型科技公司财报和美联储利率决定的影响下，都在寻求达成贸易协议。【原文：US stocks gained early Monday as the US and China homed in on a trade deal during a crucial week on Wall Street marked by Big Tech earnings and a Federal Reserve interest-rate decision.】

item.title: 费米公司为德克萨斯州数据中心订购四座大型核反应堆
item.description: 费米公司（Fermi Inc.）已签署协议，开始生产四个大型核反应堆，这些反应堆将用于德克萨斯州潘汉德地区的一个私人数据中心电网园区。【原文：Fermi Inc. has signed deals to begin production of four big nuclear-power reactors that would be used for a private data center grid campus in the Texas Panhandle.】

item.title: 新兴市场乐观情绪升温，土耳其利用美元债券开拓债务市场
item.description: 土耳其正在利用新兴市场情绪升温和国内政治紧张局势降温的契机，通过发行新的美元债券来开拓国际债务市场。【原文：Turkey is tapping international debt markets with a new dollar-denominated bond, taking advantage of stronger sentiment toward emerging markets and a cooling of political tensions at home.】

item.title: 捷克亿万富翁在大选获胜后更接近政府
item.description: 捷克亿万富翁、反对党领袖安德烈-巴比斯（Andrej Babis）在其政党主导大选三周后，距离重新掌权又近了一步。【原文：Czech billionaire opposition leader Andrej Babis moved a step closer to returning to power three weeks after his party dominated a general election.】

item.title: 菲利普莫里斯启动五部分投资级债券发行
item.description: 菲利普莫里斯国际公司（Philip Morris International Inc.【原文：Philip Morris International Inc. plans to sell bonds on Monday in its second dollar high-grade offering this year.】

item.title: 贝森特认为日本的扩张政策有利于股市
item.description: 美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）对日本首相佐那江隆一的扩张性财政政策给予了高度评价，他告诉日本首相片山聪树，这似乎是东京股市创纪录上涨的原因之一。【原文：US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent spoke favorably of Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi’s expansionary fiscal stance, telling his counterpart Satsuki Katayama that it appears to be contributing to record stock gains in Tokyo.】

item.title: 威特科夫公司在迈阿密公寓破土动工前售出 2 亿美元房产
item.description: 当中东问题特使史蒂夫-威特科夫（Steve Witkoff）在加沙进行停火谈判时，他的儿子亚历克斯-威特科夫（Alex Witkoff）却在佛罗里达的家中销售公寓。【原文：While Middle East Special Envoy Steve Witkoff was negotiating a ceasefire in Gaza, his son, Alex Witkoff, was home in Florida selling condos.】

item.title: 马萨诸塞州将军事技术视为应对特朗普动荡的途径
item.description: 马萨诸塞州的企业家和政治家们看到了使该州成为军事技术强州的机会，也看到了减少因联邦失去对生命科学和清洁能源等产业的支持而造成的经济损失的机会。【原文：Massachusetts entrepreneurs and politicians see an opening to make the state more of a military technology powerhouse and blunt the economic damage caused by the loss of federal support for industries such as life sciences and clean energy.】

item.title: 特朗普制裁俄罗斯石油可能令沙特进退两难
item.description: 如果美国的最新措施限制了俄罗斯的出口，利雅得可能会陷入棘手的境地。【原文：Riyadh could be pushed into a tricky position if the latest US measures curb Russia's exports.】

item.title: 中美贸易协议初见端倪
item.description: 最新的中美贸易谈判为特朗普和习近平在本周晚些时候敲定协议奠定了基础。【原文：The latest US-China trade talks set the table for Trump and Xi to finalize a deal later this week.】

item.title: 梅洛尼称银行不应抱怨 50 亿欧元的税收
item.description: 意大利总理乔治亚-梅洛尼（Giorgia Meloni）为政府今年从银行融资 50 亿欧元（58 亿美元）的努力辩护，因为贷款人从非同寻常的市场条件中获利。【原文：Italian Premier Giorgia Meloni defended her government’s efforts to raise €5 billion ($5.8 billion) from banks this year, after lenders profited from extraordinary market conditions.】

item.title: 锂矿商 Albemarle 将通过催化剂销售融资 6.6 亿美元
item.description: 全球最大的锂生产商 Albemarle 公司正在减少其在精炼催化剂业务方面的风险敞口，以期在关键电池金属价格持续走低之际削减债务并产生现金。【原文：Albemarle Corp. is reducing its exposure to the refining catalyst business as the world’s biggest lithium producer looks to cut debt and generate cash at a time of persistently low prices of the key battery metal.】

item.title: 鹰派利率言论后巴西通胀预测下降
item.description: 在央行行长发表鹰派讲话，表示借贷成本不会很快下降之后，巴西今明两年的通胀预期有所放缓。【原文：Brazil’s inflation expectations eased for this year and next, following hawkish statements from central bankers indicating that borrowing costs won’t drop anytime soon.】

item.title: 加密货币活动激增，IBM 推出数字资产平台
item.description: 国际商业机器公司（International Business Machines Corp. ）正在推出一个数字资产平台，允许金融机构、政府和公司推出基于区块链的服务。【原文：International Business Machines Corp. is launching a digital assets platform to allow financial institutions, governments and companies to launch blockchain-based services, as crypto activity gathers steam.】

item.title: Trian 寻求通过通用催化剂收购 Janus Henderson
item.description: 纳尔逊-佩尔茨（Nelson Peltz）的特里安基金管理公司（Trian Fund Management）正与全球投资公司 General Catalyst 合作，收购资产管理公司 Janus Henderson Group Plc 尚未持有的剩余股份。【原文：Nelson Peltz’s Trian Fund Management is working with global investment firm General Catalyst to buy the rest of asset manager Janus Henderson Group Plc that it doesn’t already own.】

item.title: 可可价格因本季供应前景改善而下滑
item.description: 可可价格下跌，市场受到西非收成良好导致全球供应过剩的预期压力。【原文：Cocoa prices dropped, with the market pressured by expectation for a global supply surplus on the back of favorable West African harvests.】

item.title: 特朗普重整贸易体系
item.description: 美国总统本周亚洲之行将签署贸易协定和 "框架 "协议【原文：The US president is signing trade agreements and "framework" deals on a tour of Asia this week】

item.title: 拉扎德涉足4,500亿美元新兴市场ETF领域，押宝选股
item.description: 拉扎德资产管理公司（Lazard Asset Management）打赌，投资者对新兴市场资产的新胃口才刚刚开始，该公司推出了有史以来第一只专注于该地区的交易所交易基金，因为投资者正在寻找搭乘国际市场反弹顺风车的方法。【原文：Lazard Asset Management is betting the newfound appetite for emerging-market assets is only just starting, launching its first-ever exchange-traded fund focused on the region as investors look for ways to ride a rebound in international markets.】

item.title: 英伟达公司首席执行官黄仁勋在华盛顿举行人工智能路演，美国即将与中国达成协议
item.description: 过去三年来，英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp. ）深陷中美之间不断升级的贸易僵局，导致其珍贵的人工智能芯片无法进入重要市场，并使其损失了数十亿美元的收入。【原文：Nvidia Corp. has spent the past three years ensnared in an escalating trade impasse between the US and China that has kept its prized artificial intelligence chips out of a crucial market and cost it billions of dollars in revenue.】

item.title: 四年来大多数 S&P 500 指数公司的销售额超出预期
item.description: 在本财报季中，美国 500 指数有望成为四年来销售业绩超预期公司最多的一年，美国企业似乎对关税的影响应对自如。【原文：The S&P 500 is on course to have the most companies delivering sales beats in about four years this earnings season, with Corporate America seeming to cope just fine with the impact of tariffs.】
